xxl.applications.io
Class FatTest

java.lang.Object
  xxl.applications.io.FatTest

public class FatTest
extends Object

This class demonstrate the usage of the methods of FATDevice. which is a filesystem on the raw device e.g. creating, copying and deleting of files. In addition the usage of an external MergeSort in xxl.core.relational.cursors is shown.

Method Detail

createFATDevice

public static void createFATDevice(RawAccess r,
                                   String devicefile,
                                   PrintStream out,
                                   File dumm,
                                   byte fatType)
Creates a FATDevice.
r.getNumSectors()<4086 =>: FAT.FAT12
32680: FAT.FAT16
r.getNumSectors()>4194304 =>: FAT.FAT32

Parameters:
r - raw access to read and write from and to disk.
devicefile - name of device or file.
out - Printstream for messages.
dumm - name of dummyfile.
fatType - the type of the fat.

main

public static void main(String[] args)
The main-method contains an example, how to construct a filesystem on a rawdevcie and how to create and delete a file, and also how to copy one file into the virtual file system. In addition, this method shows, how to sort externally all data from a relational file (Mergesort).

This method can be called with 0 or 1 parameter.

        xxl applications.release.io.FatTest
where can be
  • 0: uses main memory lists for queues.
  • 1: uses random access files for queues.
  • 2: uses random access files inside a FATDevice.

Parameters:
args - the arguments passed to the main method.
